channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: At Least 2 Injured in Pennsylvania Shooting Involving Police Officers
item.description: Details were scant, but Gov. Josh Shapiro was headed to York County, where the shooting occurred, and several officials expressed concern for the poli...

item.title: He’s Left MoMA Smarter, Richer and at a Crossroads
item.description: Glenn D. Lowry led the Museum of Modern Art for longer than anyone. But the institution he reconstructed (twice) is facing all-new trials.

item.title: Powell isn’t being subtle about Trump, immigration and the employment disaster: ‘The supply of workers has obviously come way down’
item.description: "There’s very little growth, if any, in the supply of workers. And at the same time, demand for workers has also come down quite sharply," the Fed cha...

item.title: After Kirk’s Death, Students Return to Campus and Learn ‘How To Be Adults’
item.description: Utah Valley University burst into the nation’s conscience when Charlie Kirk was slain there. Its students resumed classes Wednesday, most trying to ge...

item.title: Markets expected the rate cut, but the ‘real surprise’ is the Fed’s opinion on the current state of the economy, quant CEO says
item.description: The Federal Reserve’s policy setup is “bullish for bonds, bearish for the dollar, and neutral for equities in the near term," according to TIAA Wealth...

item.title: The average American homeowner lost $9,200 in home equity during the last year. It’s not a collapse but a ‘long-term market correction’
item.description: Borrower equity is the third-highest ever recorded, but Leo Pond from Four Seasons Sotheby’s told Fortune that a fast climb uphill has turned into a p...

item.title: Don’t hold your breath waiting for a lower mortgage rate or auto loan after the Fed cut, analyst says: ‘Unlikely to make a noticeable difference’
item.description: For prospective homebuyers, the market has already priced in the rate cut, and steep auto loans aren't expected to decline anytime soon, experts say.

item.title: Jerome Powell warns there’s ‘no risk-free path’ to avoid stagflation: ‘We have a situation where we have two-sided risk’
item.description: The Fed chair kept remarking on the current fix he's in, calling it "quite an unusual situation."

item.title: Top Scientists Find Growing Evidence That Greenhouse Gases Are, in Fact, a Danger
item.description: The assessment contradicts the Trump administration’s legal arguments for relaxing pollution rules.

item.title: Gilded Carriages and Bearskin Hats: U.K. Royals Welcome Trump
item.description: Photographs of the pomp and spectacle of the U.S. president’s second state visit to Britain.

item.title: Top Scientists Find Growing Evidence That Greenhouse Gases Are, in Fact, a Danger
item.description: The assessment contradicts the Trump administration’s legal arguments for relaxing pollution rules.

item.title: Windsor Castle’s State Dinner Features Lavish Menu
item.description: Just over 100 staff members served 160 guests at the white-tie event.

item.title: Europe’s far-right and Charlie Kirk
item.description: The continent’s far right is claiming the activist as a martyr. Our colleague Jason Horowitz explains why.

item.title: Live Updates: King Charles Emphasizes Historic Ties With U.S. at State Dinner
item.description: “Our people have fought and died together for the values we hold dear,” the king said, as he welcomed President Trump to a lavish dinner at Windsor Ca...

item.title: Here’s the menu for the state dinner at Windsor Castle.
